instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MLB. When i reset the SMC the machine powers on & then after that it will power on every time as normal (By pressing power button on keyboard) with or without Charger. But when i let it sit for some time (1/2 Hour or so sometimes more/less) it will eventually not turn on again until i do an SMC reset, & then after it will turn on as normal again until i let it sit for some time.

All power rails seem to be present whether it is in a state where it won't turn on without SMC reset or when it will turn on as normal.

The board has no water damage of any kind & has never had any previous work done on it before.

Any advice to point me in the right direction is much appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message: Run ASD, could be a bad trackpad flex.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message:
Hi & thanks for the reply.
I ran ASD several times over & everything "passed"

I only ran "Memory" test once which passed, as it takes forever

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message: Have you looked at the trackpad cable on both ends as aprendiz suggested?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message:
Hey louis. I just checked the trackpad cable & on the trackpad side, the contacts on the cable look pretty damaged...
Will replace that & report back !
Thank You !

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message: Ok, so i just received a new trackpad flex & put it in, but still the same issue...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message: Could also be a bad trackpad, remove trackpad flex and battery, plug in the charger and see if it power on everytime you try....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Air, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only Turns On After SMC Reset.
threads.message:
FIXED !
I gave the trackpad flex connectors on the Logic Board end & the trackpad end, a good clean with some IPA & after extensive testing, it powers on consistently without having to reset SMC...
Thank you aprendiz & Louis.
